intro: Rhinanthus angustifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaved yellowtop, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Orobanchaceae family, which includes many parasitic and semi-parasitic species. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and woodland edges. Its flowers are orange-yellow and appear in dense spikes, often attracting various pollinators. The leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, contributing to its characteristic appearance.
